HTMLTrackElement.summary: The HTMLTrackElement interface represents an HTML {{HTMLElement("track")}} element within the DOM. This element can be used as a child of either {{HTMLElement("audio")}} or {{HTMLElement("video")}} to specify a text track containing information such as closed captions or subtitles.

remarks.para: -The HTML element implementing this interface: track.

HTMLTrackElementSrclang.summary:
The srclang property of the interface reflects the value of
the track element's srclang attribute or the empty string if not defined.

remarks.para: The srclang attribute is a BCP 47 language tag indicating the language of the text track's data.

HTMLTrackElementLabel.summary: The label property of the represents the user-readable title displayed when listing subtitle, caption, and audio descriptions for a track. It reflects the {{htmlelement("track")}} element's label attribute.

HTMLTrackElementCuechange.summary: The cuechange event fires when a has changed the currently displaying cues. The event is fired on both the TextTrack and the in which it's being presented, if any.

HTMLTrackElementKind.summary: The kind property of the interface represents the type of track, or how the text track is meant to be used. It reflects the {{htmlelement("track")}} element's enumerated kind attribute.

remarks.para: If no kind is set, subtitles is used. If the attribute is not set to one of the valid enumerated values, it is invalid and metadata is used. Other valid values include captions, descriptions, and chapters.

HTMLTrackElementKind.value: A string; lowercase captions, descriptions, chapters, subtitles or metadata.

HTMLTrackElementTrack.summary: The track read-only property of the interface returns a object corresponding to the text track of the {{HTMLElement("track")}} element.

HTMLTrackElementSrc.summary:
The src property of the interface reflects the value of
the track element's src attribute, which
indicates the URL of the text track's data.
HTMLTrackElementSrc.value: A string containing the URL of the text track data.

HTMLTrackElementReadyState.summary: The readyState read-only property of the interface returns a number representing the {{HTMLElement("track")}} element's text track readiness state:

HTMLTrackElementDefault.summary: The default property of the interface represents whether the track will be enabled if the user's preferences do not indicate that another track would be more appropriate. It reflects the {{htmlelement("track")}} element's boolean default attribute, returning true if present and false otherwise.
